title: What Other Concepts Exist About Space and Time Beyond Their Traditional Definitions?
first_phrase: In this text, Michael and Wolinsky explore concepts of space and time through a series of interesting ideas. In the final part, they move onto discussing the differentiation between the non-verbal I AM and the NOT-I-I in an exercise from the book "Beyond Quantum Psychology" by Stephen Wolinsky. This chapter explores the Way of the Human, delving into a deeper understanding of oneself beyond the verbal and cognitive levels.
content: That's an interesting concept. Tell me another concept you have about the concept of time. It's all happening at once. That's an interesting concept. Tell me another concept you have about the concept of time. I'm out of time. That's an interesting concept. Tell me another concept you have about the concept of time. Time happens. That's an interesting idea. Tell me another concept you have about the concept of time. I thought I didn't have any. That's an interesting idea. Tell me another concept you have about the concept of time. I'm blank. There is blankness about it right now. The Way of the Human ■ Beyond Quantum PsychologyChapter IV The Way of the Human • Beyond Quantum Psychology EXERCISE #7 Differentiating the NON-VERBAL I AM from the NOT-I-I. Eyes closed (guided): The NON-VERBAL I AM 1. Without using your thoughts, memory, emotions, associations or perceptions, are you in the room, not in the room, or neither? 2. Without using your thoughts, memory, emotions, associations or perceptions, what is a room? 3.
last_phrase: In conclusion, through the exercises in The Way of the Human, we can explore the concept of time and the nature of our consciousness. By differentiating the non-verbal I AM from the Not-I-I, we dive into the depths of our being and discover a world beyond the limitations of our perceptions.
